Thaddeus Young was sensational, using an 11-of-15 effort in the first half to give the Sixers a rare comfortable lead and easy win. It's been working for us, but we just couldn't get the win, Thaddeus Young said. "It really worked tonight." Allen Iverson returned to the game. Rasheed Wallace 's 3-pointer with 10.4 seconds left ended a nearly 7-minute scoring drought. Rip Hamilton 's two free throws with 3.8 seconds to go avoided a monumental collapse from a 29-point third-quarter lead. Honestly, I didn't want to go back in, said Allen Iverson , who scored 20 points through three quarters. "I felt that our second team should have closed that thing out." for a filibuster to continue. To do so, he has introduced a resolution to change the rules of the Senate. "The minority must always maintain the right to continue debate," said Sen. Bernie Sanders Al Franken . But if the minority feels that strongly about an issue it should be their burden to continue that debate, not a supermajority's to end it. The change could return the Senate to the era of when filibusters were rare because Senators who wanted to continue the filibuster had to show up and stay on the floor of the Senate. Mr David Cameron said in a statement: I am very sorry that Andy Coulson has decided to resign as my director of communications, although I understand that the continuing pressures on him and his family mean that he feels compelled to do so. I wish Andy Coulson all the very best for his future, which I am certain will be a successful one. Last week Mr David Cameron refused to confirm or deny reports that Mr Andy Coulson had offered to resign to spare the Government further damage. Since his return, in October, Ben Roethlisberger has tried to be a better teammate and a better person. Like the Eagles' Michael Vick , he has been contrite and has said all the right things. It would be amazing to win another Super Bowl, but it won't be like I'll say, "Do you forgive me now?' It'll just be another step in earning back everything I lost, he told the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette's Ron Cook last week.
